meanings.definition: Having or showing an intense and selfish desire for something, especially wealth or power.
meanings.sent1: The greedy man grabbed all the cookies for himself.
meanings.sent2: She is always greedy for more money, never satisfied with what she has.
meanings.sent3: The greedy squirrel hoarded all the nuts in the park, leaving none for the other animals.
meanings.sent4: His greedy eyes scanned the room, looking for any valuable items to take.
meanings.sent5: The greedy child refused to share his toys with his friends, wanting them all to himself.

meanings.definition: Excessively eager to acquire or possess more, especially material things.
meanings.sent1: The greedy shopper bought everything on sale, even things she didn't need.
meanings.sent2: He was so greedy for new gadgets that he spent all his savings on the latest phone.
meanings.sent3: The greedy collector filled his house with so many items that he could barely move around.
meanings.sent4: Her greedy hands reached out to grab the last piece of cake before anyone else could.
meanings.sent5: The greedy businessman always wanted more clients, never satisfied with his current success.

meanings.definition: Having a strong or excessive desire for food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The greedy puppy gobbled up his food in seconds, always hungry for more.
meanings.sent2: She felt greedy for chocolate after dinner and couldn't resist having a piece.
meanings.sent3: The greedy cat meowed loudly for treats, trying to get more than his fair share.
meanings.sent4: His greedy stomach rumbled loudly, demanding another helping of dessert.
meanings.sent5: The greedy toddler cried for more juice, not willing to share with his siblings.
